articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: France passes 4,000 coronavirus deaths
articles.description: French health authorities reported 509 new deaths from the coronavirus on Wednesday, taking the total to 4,032.
articles.content:
French health authorities reported 509 new deaths from the coronavirus on Wednesday, taking the total to 4,032.
There are now 24,639 people hospitalised in France with Covid-19, with 6,017 of them in intensive care, health official Jerome Salomon told report… [+1955 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus and the developing world
articles.description: Countries around the world are facing their own battles with coronavirus, with differing approaches and outcomes.
articles.content:

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Coronavirus transforms New York as US deaths top 4,000
articles.description: Emergency field hospitals were set up in New York's Central Park and at the home of the US Open tennis tournament as the number of American deaths from the coronavirus pandemic surged past 4,000 - higher than the toll in China.
articles.content:
Emergency field hospitals were set up in New York's Central Park and at the home of the US Open tennis tournament as the number of American deaths from the coronavirus pandemic surged past 4,000 - higher than the toll in China.

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Italy sees fewer coronavirus deaths but new cases grow
articles.description: The death toll from an outbreak of coronavirus in Italy has climbed by 727 to 13,155, the Civil Protection Agency said, a significantly smaller increase than seen on Tuesday and the lowest daily tally since 26 March.
articles.content:
The death toll from an outbreak of coronavirus in Italy has climbed by 727 to 13,155, the Civil Protection Agency said, a significantly smaller increase than seen on Tuesday and the lowest daily tally since 26 March.
However, the number of new cases rose mor… [+818 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: European shares tumble as coronavirus damage revealed
articles.description: European shares fell this morning in their first trading session of the quarter, as dismal economic data from Asia underpinned the ongoing damage from the coronavirus pandemic and fanned fears of a deep global recession.
articles.content:
European shares fell this morning in their first trading session of the quarter, as dismal economic data from Asia underpinned the ongoing damage from the coronavirus pandemic and fanned fears of a deep global recession.

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: UK banks scrap dividends on coronavirus fears
articles.description: The UK's top banks have said they would suspend dividend payments after pressure from the regulator, saving their capital as a buffer against expected losses from the economic fallout from the coronavirus.
articles.content:
The UK's top banks have said they would suspend dividend payments after pressure from the regulator, saving their capital as a buffer against expected losses from the economic fallout from the coronavirus.

articles.title: Bike shops remain active during coronavirus shutdown
articles.description: The Covid-19 pandemic was at first a boost for bike shops as some people bought bikes as an alternative to public transport or dragged out their old bike for a service as they sought to get some exercise.
articles.content:

articles.title: Breakdown of coronavirus cases in Ireland
articles.description: For the first time since the outbreak of Covid-19 in Ireland, health officials have provided a detailed breakdown of the people who have lost their lives.
articles.content:
